lowerBoundMethods

Class SimpleLowerBoundEstimation

  • java.lang.Object
    • lowerBoundMethods.AbstractLowerBoundEstimation
      • lowerBoundMethods.SimpleLowerBoundEstimation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    bermudanSwaptionFramework.BermudanSwaptionValueEstimatorInterface, net.finmath.montecarlo.conditionalexpectation.RegressionBasisFunctionsProvider

    public class SimpleLowerBoundEstimation
extends lowerBoundMethods.AbstractLowerBoundEstimation
implements net.finmath.montecarlo.conditionalexpectation.RegressionBasisFunctionsProvider
    Implements a lower bound estimation of a Bermudan Swaption value, based on the regression approach by Longstaff and Schwartz (2001).
    Author:
    (c)Christian P. Fries, modified by Lennart Quante

      • getBasisFunctions

        public net.finmath.stochastic.RandomVariable[] getBasisFunctions(double evaluationTime,
                                                                 net.finmath.montecarlo.interestrate.LIBORModelMonteCarloSimulationModel model)
                                                          throws net.finmath.exception.CalculationException
        Provides a set of \( \mathcal{F}_{t} \)-measurable random variables which can serve as regression basis functions.
        Parameters:
        evaluationTime - The evaluation time \( t \) at which the basis function should be observed.
        model - The Monte-Carlo model used to derive the basis function.
        Returns:
        An \( \mathcal{F}_{t} \)-measurable random variable.
        Throws:
        net.finmath.exception.CalculationException - Thrown if derivation of the basis function fails.

      • getBasisFunctionsProviderWithSwapRates

        public net.finmath.montecarlo.conditionalexpectation.RegressionBasisFunctionsProvider getBasisFunctionsProviderWithSwapRates()
        Returns:
        An \( \mathcal{F}_{t} \)-measurable random variable, basis functions using swap rate estimation

        Returns:
